title: Mod-02 Lec-02 Our Agriculture Practices and Lessons

tasks.task: Understand the impact of agricultural practices on the environment.
subtasks: Recognize the role of modern agronomy, plant breeding, pesticides, and fertilizers in increasing crop yields.
Identify the ecological and human health effects associated with the use of pesticides and fertilizers.
Examine how economic, social, and political pressures influence farming decisions.
Analyze the effects of continuous cropping and intercropping on land use and soil health.
Understand the importance of timely and sufficient water management in agriculture.
Recognize the consequences of unsustained water use and land transformation on ecological balance.
Evaluate the impact of agricultural practices on soil degradation, desertification, and water pollution.
Assess the role of irrigation management in causing water scarcity, salinization, and disease transmission.
Analyze the challenges of groundwater depletion and its effects on agricultural productivity.
Understand the relationship between agricultural practices and climate change.
Recognize the need for sustainable agricultural practices that minimize environmental impact.
